dc7f3d749774.title: Perhaps the end of rules is best.

paragraphs.text: Perhaps the end of rules is best. And the end of science-based reality. For example, gravity. People that I know are smart enough to grab onto something if they found themselves floating. Trumpsters would say, “Since gravity is science, then this isn’t real. And since no republican told me what to do, I’ll just trust Trump to tweet that this…

1ab8f226a2be.title: It is truly amazing how the republican party simply lambasted Obama for eight years with every…

paragraphs.text: It is truly amazing how the republican party simply lambasted Obama for eight years with every dirty tactic they could muster and now that the Democrats are giving them a dose of their own medicine, they seem truly flabbergasted, seemingly calling every other tactic unprecedented. The hypocrisy and shamefulness of it, is just pathetic.
paragraphs.name: e71d

95bd4766b4f1.title: Now hoping the puddles that appear after a rain fin the field will no longer be considered…

paragraphs.text: Now hoping the puddles that appear after a rain fin the field will no longer be considered “wetlands” and we can do something about them.

That is the problem with the EPA, the Democrats just went too far. Let farmer’s farm. Their crazy notion that a field that has been farmed for a century now has a “wetland” in the middle of it, one that only appears after a rain, is ridiculous.

21dc1bc77187.title: The Democrats boycott of the vote is the only way they can show how truly opposed they are to Mr.

paragraphs.text: The Democrats boycott of the vote is the only way they can show how truly opposed they are to Mr. Pruitt as Administrator of the EPA. His comments and answers to questions at his hearing showed his total disregard for the mission of the EPA. He sued the EPA fourteen times! An took campaign contributions from the plaintiffs in those cases. How can someone be head of an agency they want to dismantle?
